text: If you want a break from the heat and a chance to enjoy and learn something, I suggest visiting this building. It was fun!

According to the USDA Forest Service website, ethnobotany is "Â the study of how people of a particular culture and region make use of indigenous (native) plants." And this is clearly showcased in Singapore Botanic Garden's Ethnobotany Garden, which also has the Centre for Ethnobotany on its premises.
Amazing gardens for plant lovers a must visit. Will need a full day to explore all of the botanical gardens

Ethnobotany Garden put on display of a diversity of flora that supports human living which include food source, both gathered and cultivated, housing construction materials, medicinal ingredients, as well as handicraft and tools & utensils materials.
BAMBOO tree and PALM tree are among some of the most useful and important flora to the indigenous tribes.
They can be used to construct houses, make handicraft pieces, everyday tools & utensils, musical instruments, and as food sources.
thoughtfully curated garden. learned a lot - loved every bit of it!
